snippet: The union that represents theater performers plans to drop insurance for about 200 members, leaving a Harlem man to wonder how he will manage the higher costs of a new plan.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column discusses anxieties over how the health fund for Actors’ Equity, union that represents theater performers, is about to drop scores of struggling actors from its health insurance plan; focuses on veteran actor Richard E Waits, who has trouble at times with his vision, his hips and his neck, has other chronic conditions and has struggled to stay afloat financially.
lead_paragraph: The union that represents theater performers plans to drop insurance for about 200 members, leaving a Harlem man to wonder how he will manage the higher costs of a new plan.

headline.main: A Veteran Actor’s Backstage Fight for Affordable Health Care
headline.print_headline: A Veteran Actor’s Backstage Fight for Affordable Health Care

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
